data.title: Add "Check for Update" for extensions
data.body:
Right now, as far as I've noticed, Code checks if there are extensions available only on start. 

I think "Check for Updates" command for extension panel could be added.

data.title: HTML chars are wrongly displayed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 (Version 1607 (OS Build 14393.351)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. clone https://github.com/aloisdg/Summary2Pages.git
2. open it with vscode

The problem may come from @Ionide.

I should see `string -> unit` but I get `string -> unit`:

![bug-vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3449303/19948694/3f82918e-a14e-11e6-9021-e3d1538176e3.PNG)

[on ionide](https://github.com/ionide/ionide-vscode-fsharp/issues/266)

data.title: Improve the sorting and matching of quick pick
data.body:
Originally posted in the [`vscode-project-manager`](https://github.com/alefragnani/vscode-project-manager) extension issues [here](https://github.com/alefragnani/vscode-project-manager/issues/66). @alefragnani suggested that I file the issue here to have this applied to `PickList`. I'm unfamiliar with this codebase. But I think that [`match-sorter`](https://github.com/kentcdodds/match-sorter) provides a better way to filter and sort items in a list based on user input. Could we consider adding that kind of functionality to VSCode?

Thanks!

data.title: Fixes #12694 regex replace strips filepath when approot is PIIPath
data.body:
Root cause is explained here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12694#issuecomment-258012480

Fix is to apply the default regex first, and then the configured.

data.title: Sidebar modules in status bar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7
- OS Version: macOS

The black modules bar is annoying! You could move the switches to the status bar on the left side. Clicking them would disable or enable the sidebar.

An alternative design: take a look at Panic Coda and move the sidebar modules at the top or bottom.

Having the sidebar modules in the status bar is more Visual Studio Code like design.

data.title: Allow for vertically arranged editor tabs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: all
- OS Version: all

Horizontal tabs are a bad design decision, as when you have more than about 10 they start to cut off the name in the tab title. Vertically arranged tabs are the best solution to this, and there should be an option to switch between horizontally and vertically arranged editor tabs.

data.title: Matching # in regex match in syntaxes json tmlanguage files failing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise

The parser for the syntaxes json files not properly handling "#" in the regex match.

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Put this pattern in the "patterns":
 	{
		"name": "entity.name.type.ecl",
		"match": "\\b#(append|break|declare)\\b"
	},
2. Should highlight "#append" and "#break".... Does not. I tried many variations on the pattern to try an get around the problem but the closest I got was "\\b#append|#break|#declare\\b" which worked for all BUT the first pattern "#append" (#break #declare and the rest to the right worked).

I really need this in the end: "match": "\\b#(?i:(append|break|declare))\\b"

data.title: Add "Stage selected lines" to context menu

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It's in the '...' menu on the diff editor but not the context menu. It feels much more natural to select something then right click to stage.

data.body:

- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional x64

1. Select several blocks containing the same substring.
2. Search for that substring in the current selection.
3. Observe that only the last instance is found.

data.title: Faded launch.json properties are not readable on a light theme
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.0 (9e7d70052908b633e0d4f71e70b26714bd1d2f10, 2016-11-02T14:27:44.073Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-26-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|ActiveFileInStatusBar|RoscoP|1.0.2|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|vscode-terminal-here|Tyriar|0.0.5|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.0.8|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|0.1.15|
|annotator|ryu1kn|0.10.1|
|vscode-header-source|ryzngard|1.0.4|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|

---

The contrast is so low that many users will have difficulty reading.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/19941441/58a293aa-a0ed-11e6-87c0-b9c191cfd6de.png)

Having pre-defined colors like this is probably not the best idea. using opacity might be more effective to ensure it looks at home in other themes.

data.title: Clicking a validation warning in 'default settings' opens a 'settings.json' file
data.body:
- Install tslint (or some other extension that produces a validation warning in its default settings)
- Open the split settings view
- Open the problems panel
- See the warning listed under `/settings.json`
- Double click it
- It opens in a file called `/settings.json` which has the same contents as Default Settings. Can it open in Default Settings instead?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/19940599/74f13e42-a0ea-11e6-80e3-7214658a3ef5.png)

data.title: Can't Save
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Win 10 Pro

I was working w/ Code all day today and all of a sudden, I can't save a file. I don't get a visual error, and the app seems completely fine in every other aspect. But the 'dirty' indicator won't go away and the file never actually saves. 

I opened up dev tools and see this:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\node_modules\vscode-textmate\release\main.js:1716 [1] - Grammar is in an endless loop - Grammar pushed & popped a rule without advancingscanNext @ C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\node_modules\vscode-textmate\release\main.js:1716

data.title: d.ts files not reloaded when updated causing outdated type information to influence IntelliSense
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: bialikover.theme-seti-0.0.1, donjayamanne.createuniqueid-0.0.3, florianloch.text-transform-0.0.2, gerane.Theme-FlatlandMonokai-0.0.4, HookyQR.beautify-0.1.10, ionutvmi.path-autocomplete-1.1.0, joelday.docthis-0.3.3, ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.0, msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-0.5.2, peterj.proto-0.0.2, qinjia.seti-icons-0.0.7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup TS files to compile to js/d.ts files in a different folder (eg. src->lib)
2. Import js files from lib and use Intellisense feature (e.g call a function using types)
3. Make a change to TS causing js/d.ts file to update

 Causes outdated type annotations to appear

`Reload Window`  fixes that but is cumbersome of course

data.title: Whitespace below code, remove ability to scroll all the code out of sight
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1 
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra 10.12.1 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any text file
2. Scroll to the bottom.

The scrolling doesn't stop at the end of the code, but continues until almost all the code is out of sight. This results in seeing an empty window (since the code is now out of sight), needing to scroll back up to see the last bits of code.

It is not a major issue but perhaps an option to have the scrolling stop at the end of code would be useful.

data.title: Is there any API for handling Search Results?
data.body:
Hi,

I'm looking for an API that would give access to the search results, more specifically the files and line numbers/characters that _where found_. I didn't find anything like this, but instead, just the `vscode.workspace.findFiles` function.

With this in hand, it would be possible to _mark_ each result for further navigation. (Original request from my [Bookmarks extension](https://github.com/alefragnani/vscode-bookmarks/issues/7))

Thanks in advance

data.title: Support arguments when defining keybindings
data.body:
Allow to pass arguments to commands defined in keybindings.json.

/cc @alexandrudima not sure if you have an existing item for this already?

data.title: Proxie issue when viewing Extensions in gallery
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0-insider
- OS Version: MS Windows Server 2008 R2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use Visual Studio Code with Corporate Proxy

settings.json contains:
```
	// The proxy setting to use. If not set will be taken from the http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables
	"http.proxy": "http://user:pw@123.123.123.123:8080",
	"http.proxyStrictSSL": false,
```

2. Select any extension to view on the right side (gallery) (extensions already installed are shown correctly).


Result:
![vscode network](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7500948/19932170/4df9396e-a10f-11e6-9e01-204b08c9bea5.PNG)

I get 4 errors in developer console when opening the gallery view of an extension.
The text is displayed but images are missing.

> 
> dantup.gallery.vsassets.io/_apis/public/gallery/publisher/DanTup/extension//assetbyname/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default?redirect=true:1 GET https://dantup.gallery.vsassets.io/_apis/public/gallery/publisher/DanTup/ex.0/assetbyname/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default?redirect=true net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED
> kevinplatel.gallery.vsassets.io/_apis/public/gallery/publisher/kevinplatel//assetbyname/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default?redirect=true:1 GET https://kevinplatel.gallery.vsassets.io/_apis/public/gallery/publisher/kevi.0/assetbyname/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default?redirect=true net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED
> Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default:1 GET https://dantup.gallery.vsassets.io/_apis/public/gallery/publisher/DanTup/exdart-code/0.13.0/assetbyname/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED
> Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default:1 GET https://kevinplatel.gallery.vsassets.io/_apis/public/gallery/publisher/kevinsion/dart/0.1.0/assetbyname/Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Icons.Default net::ERR_TUNNEL_CONNECTION_FAILED

data.title: Proxy issues when installing MS C# Extension (omnisharp)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows Server 2008 R2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use Visual Studio Code with Corporate Proxy

settings.json contains:
```
	// The proxy setting to use. If not set will be taken from the http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables
	"http.proxy": "http://user:pw@123.123.123.123:8080",
	"http.proxyStrictSSL": false,
```

2. Install C# Extension


Result:

**Proxy works for Installation of Extensions and Update checking. The proxyStrictSSL works.
It seems that the OmniSharp Extensions Network Connection does not use http.proxyStrictSSL.**
_=> unable to verify the first certificate_

The OmniSharp Log shows:

> 
> Installing OmniSharp to C:\Users\MYUSERNAME\.vscode-insiders\extensions\ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1\out\.omnisharp-desktop
>     Attempting to download omnisharp-1.9-beta14-win-x64-net451.zip


The Debug Console of VSCode shows: 

> 
> /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:121 [Extension Host] Uncaught Exception:  Error: unable to verify the first certificatew.logExtensionHostMessage @ /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:121
> /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:121 [Extension Host] Error: unable to verify the first certificate
>     at Error (native)
>     at TLSSocket.<anonymous> (_tls_wrap.js:1060:38)
>     at emitNone (events.js:86:13)
>     at TLSSocket.emit (events.js:185:7)
>     at TLSSocket._finishInit (_tls_wrap.js:584:8)
>     at TLSWrap.ssl.onhandshakedone (_tls_wrap.js:416:38)w.logExtensionHostMessage @ /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:121
> /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:126 unable to verify the first certificate: Error: unable to verify the first certificate
>     at Error (native)
>     at TLSSocket.<anonymous> (_tls_wrap.js:1060:38)
>     at emitNone (events.js:86:13)
>     at TLSSocket.emit (events.js:185:7)
>     at TLSSocket._finishInit (_tls_wrap.js:584:8)
>     at TLSWrap.ssl.onhandshakedone (_tls_wrap.js:416:38)e.onUnexpectedError @ /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:126
> /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:121 [Extension Host] Uncaught Exception:  Error: socket hang upw.logExtensionHostMessage @ /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:121
